alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 7:26PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Shelby County through 815 PM CDT... At 725 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Vandiver to near Oak Mountain State Park. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Leeds, Chelsea, Childersburg, Columbiana, Wilsonville, Indian Springs Village, Vincent, Harpersville, Westover, Highland Lakes, Fowler Lake, Vandiver, Greystone, Meadowbrook, Mount Laurel, Oak Mountain State Park, Beeswax Creek Park, Sterrett, Gaston Steam Plant and Shoal Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
